title: Find Diameter Endpoints of a Tree
hints: Start a breadth first search (BFS) from any node start; let the farthest node found be A.
Run BFS from A; a farthest node B is at the other end, and the path A-B is a diameter.
If several nodes tie as farthest from start, collect them into cand_start, each is a possible diameter endpoint.
Running BFS from any node in cand_start yields the opposite-end set cand_other, the other diameter endpoints.
